ygData.subject: Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.
ygData.msgSnippet: I had the same effect.  It doesnt attack me and I worship Tunare.  Just doesnt sell to me.  Did this person CAST any spells around the NPC?  If you practice
ygData.messageBody:
I had the same effect. It doesnt attack me and I worship Tunare. Just
doesnt sell to me. Did this person CAST any spells around the NPC? If you
practice ROOT on another person (NPC or PC) they will attack you. I have
learned this lesson the hard way...via death.

- Ziffnab

-----Original Message-----
From: Calyn Dawnwatcher [mailto:wizcalyn@...]
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 10:38 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.


From: "Calyn Dawnwatcher" <wizcalyn@...>

Not true! I am a high elf wizard who worships Tunare. The merchant hates
me, will not sell to me, but will not attack me either. This was before I
started hunting in Steamfont, so my faction was not improved the first time
I entered.

There is something we are missing in this puzzle.

Calyn of Bristlebane


>The merchant is a clockwork merchant--it doesn't have a personal name. It
>stands just inside the zone entrance of Ak'Anon, usually very near, if not
>right on top of, a clockwork jeweler.

>
>So, the upshot is, if you chose Tunare as deity, you will be attacked the
>instant you enter Ak'Anon. You can try running away into the city, but I
>have never witnessed anyone successful at that. Also, I have once observed

>this merchant running into a wall farther into the city, but that was only
>one time. Every other time I have been into Ak'Anon, it has been right
>there at the entrance.
>
